page.title: 01STIBB CROSS & LAND W & N
page.content: The area consists of farming in the East and arable land in the West, with sections of copicing and an area of Limited habitation. It has large heath and moorland and a small wetland. Occupations are farming and allied trades. There is abundant wildlife, with a preponderance of badgers and rabbits, the latter affected by Myxomatosis. The district has five parishes - Langtree, Frithelstock, Bulkworthy, Newton St. Petrock and Shebbear. Local plans provide of the building of a substantial number of houses at Stibb Cross, where the majority of homes are owner-occupied. Dwellings are mainly cob-built Devon longhouses, once thatched but now slate-roofed.
